description: Establishes comprehensive food safety management system requirements including management systems, document control, procedures, internal audits, product release, supplier control, traceability, and intentional contamination prevention. Aligned with official PrimusGFS v4.0 Checklist Module 1 (Sections 1.01-1.08).
scope: All aspects of food safety management system development, implementation, maintenance, and continuous improvement within the organization

sections.title: Title & Document Control
sections.contentGuidance: Document identification (number, title, version, dates), approval signatures, distribution list

sections.title: Purpose / Objective
sections.contentGuidance: Why this document exists, what it achieves, business and compliance drivers

sections.title: Scope
sections.contentGuidance: What operations/areas covered, who is responsible, any exclusions or limitations

sections.title: Definitions & Abbreviations
sections.contentGuidance: Minimum 5-8 relevant technical terms, acronyms, or facility-specific terminology

sections.title: Roles & Responsibilities
sections.contentGuidance: Specific positions with clearly defined duties, authority levels, and accountability

sections.title: Prerequisites & Reference Documents
sections.contentGuidance: Related SOPs, standards (Primus GFS, GFSI), regulatory requirements, training prerequisites

sections.title: Hazard / Risk Analysis
sections.contentGuidance: Module-appropriate hazards (documentation failures, system gaps), risk assessment, control measures

sections.title: Procedures
sections.contentGuidance: Detailed step-by-step procedures (minimum 8-12 steps), specific actions, frequencies, methods

sections.title: Monitoring Plan
sections.contentGuidance: What to monitor, how often, who is responsible, what records to keep, acceptance criteria

sections.title: Verification & Validation Activities
sections.contentGuidance: How to verify procedures are followed, validation that procedures are effective, audit/review frequency

sections.title: Corrective & Preventive Action (CAPA) Protocol
sections.contentGuidance: Triggers for CAPA, investigation steps, containment, root cause analysis, corrective actions, preventive measures, verification

sections.title: Traceability & Recall Elements
sections.contentGuidance: Documentation traceability, record linkages, system audit trails

sections.title: Record Retention & Document Control
sections.contentGuidance: What records are generated, retention periods, storage location, access control

sections.title: Compliance Crosswalk
sections.contentGuidance: Table mapping Primus Code | Requirement | Document Section | Evidence

sections.title: Revision History & Approval Signatures
sections.contentGuidance: Revision table (version, date, description) and signature lines (Prepared By, Reviewed By, Approved By)

traceability_recall: one step back one step forward
